verses.text: A soft answer turneth away wrath : but grievous words stir up anger.
The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright : but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.\f + \fr 15.2 \ft poureth: Heb. belcheth, or, bubbleth\f*
The eyes of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add are\add* in every place , beholding the evil and the good.
A wholesome tongue \add is\add* a tree of life : but perverseness therein \add is\add* a breach in the spirit.\f + \fr 15.4 \ft A wholesome…: Heb. The healing of the tongue\f*
A fool despiseth his father’s instruction : but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.
In the house of the righteous \add is\add* much treasure : but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.
The lips of the wise disperse knowledge : but the heart of the foolish \add doeth\add* not so.
The sacrifice of the wicked \add is\add* an abomination to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but the prayer of the upright \add is\add* his delight.
The way of the wicked \add is\add* an abomination unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.
Correction \add is\add* grievous unto him that forsaketh the way : \add and\add* he that hateth reproof shall die.\f + \fr 15.10 \ft Correction: or, Instruction\f*
Hell and destruction \add are\add* before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: how much more then the hearts of the children of men ?
A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.
A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance : but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge : but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
All the days of the afflicted \add are\add* evil : but he that is of a merry heart \add hath\add* a continual feast. \p
Better \add is\add* little with the fear of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* than great treasure and trouble therewith.
Better \add is\add* a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
A wrathful man stirreth up strife : but \add he that is\add* slow to anger appeaseth strife.
The way of the slothful \add man is\add* as an hedge of thorns : but the way of the righteous \add is\add* made plain.\f + \fr 15.19 \ft is made…: Heb. is raised up as a causey\f*
A wise son maketh a glad father : but a foolish man despiseth his mother.
Folly \add is\add* joy to \add him that is\add* destitute of wisdom : but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.\f + \fr 15.21 \ft destitute…: Heb. void of heart\f*
Without counsel purposes are disappointed : but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth : and a word \add spoken\add* in due season , how good \add is it\add*!\f + \fr 15.23 \ft due…: Heb. his season\f*
The way of life \add is\add* above to the wise , that he may depart from hell beneath.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will destroy the house of the proud : but he will establish the border of the widow.

The thoughts of the wicked \add are\add* an abomination to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but \add the words\add* of the pure \add are\add* pleasant words.\f + \fr 15.26 \ft pleasant…: Heb. words of pleasantness\f*
He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house ; but he that hateth gifts shall live.
The heart of the righteous studieth to answer : but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* far from the wicked : but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart : \add and\add* a good report maketh the bones fat.
The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.

He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul : but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.\f + \fr 15.32 \ft instruction: or, correction\f*\f + \fr 15.32 \ft heareth: or, obeyeth\f*\f + \fr 15.32 \ft getteth…: Heb. possesseth an heart\f*
The fear of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* the instruction of wisdom ; and before honour \add is\add* humility.
